dialogues.Natalie:

[120]I can't believe Knox tried to kill me. I mean, I've been lied to, I've been cheated on, but no guy has ever tried to SHOOT me before. I'm gonna get him for that. 
[121]And now, thanks to us, he's had hours to download whatever top secret information he wants, for God knows what reason. 
[122]Don't!  He's alive, he's gotta be.   If... What IS that? 
[123]Can we trace him? 
[124] 
[125] 
[126]Oh yeah? And I suppose you could do better? 
[127]Oh, right. 
[128]So tell me, Knox, what's the brilliant plan? You gonna sell a list of our foreign spies to the highest bidder? Blackmail the President? 
[129]Revenge?   Against who? 
[130]Seems like you're going a bit overboard. 
[131]I don't know why you bother.   I've already won. 
[132]Every moment I sit here is a moment I'm using to figure out how to take you down. In fact, this statement -- this one I'm making right here-- is just me stalling for time while I decide which of your goons I'm going to flatten first. It's gonna be the guy behind me. 
[133]By the time your guys are firing, I'll be at about 180 on my reverse inverted 360, which will land me on Fat Boy there, as promised. He'll take the chair seat in the chin. Now... I'm warning both of you: I'm going to get you to shoot each other. I know. Cliche as that sounds. Last, you guys -- hell, I'll make something up. We'll have fun. 
[134]You won't even be here. I mean, I don't want to tell you how to do your job, but you should've killed me by now. Because I already know that your people are onto my people, which means any moment now you're going to be called out to go and deal -- 
[135]Ah!   See? 
[136]Here we go. 
[137]Okay, that part worked.

[144]Definitely.   With black hair.

[146]Aw, shit.

[44]Even if we do get inside, there won't be time to search for it. There's got to be a hundred terabytes of information there. It could take days. 
[45]Red Star has a lot of Government contracts, so security is tight. Key- card badges throughout. Redundant security at all red-line areas with biometric scanners and weekly keycodes. Pervasive video surveillance, lasers, air-displacement sensors. Plus a hard- wired fail-safe at the relay to prevent exactly this kind of tapping. 
[46]Then we have to get back into Red Star. Problem is, their biometric sensors are too good.
